intro: Pithecellobium claviflorum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered acacia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, edible pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or disturbed areas. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it valuable for soil enrichment in agricultural settings.
